page.title: 02PARISH ADMINISTRATION
page.content: Rural areas are administered by parish councils and our area falls into four parishes. All right for Ponts Green & Brownbread Street completely within the parish of Ashburnham. Not so good for Bodle Street which has its head, shoulders and half its right leg,so to speak,in Warbleton, its left leg in Herstmonceux and its right foot in the parish of Wartling. This mess began a long time ago,when the manors settled outposts of land and developed farms there. All was neatly tidied up by act of parliament in 1896.In the summer of 1985 the situation is again fluid and the boundary commissioners are to decide whether to move all Bodle Street into Warbleton,or to hand it over to Herstmonceux. Do we care? Probably not. We doubt whether one person has made their feelings known to the boundary commission.
